result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donyell Lamarr Davis

records.addlTxt: Maintain absolute sobriety; Not operate without valid license

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Donyell Lamarr Davis appeared by video, in custody at WC Jail.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court by special appearance for Donyell Lamarr Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant waives right to appear in person.  Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  State requests $500.00 signature bond.  Atty. Drewa does not object.  Court orders.$500.00 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
